newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian bourse says admits two foreign brokerages.
newsitem.headline: Croatian bourse says admits two foreign brokerages.

text.p: The Croatian bourse said on Tuesday it had admitted as full members local subsidiaries of two foreign investment banks -- Investmentbank Austria and Creditanstalt Investment Bank.

"These renowned financial institutions with international reputation were the first to obtain a stockbroking licence from the Croatian Securities Commission," the Zagreb Stock Exchange said in a statement.
Both are expected to start active trading by May 27, after getting a direct link with the bourse's online computer system, it said.

Forty-five of the country's almost 60 market consultancies and brokerages are members of the Zagreb Stock Exchange and the rest only trade on an over-the-counter (OTC) market in Varazdin. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
